values: Soldiers will only cross at designated locations with crossing guards.

values: Range conditions briefed during safety brief. Soldiers will walk while on the range, even when not armed. Medics will be available at designated site.
All personnel will be briefed on the location of the MEV.
All personnel will have their phone on them and the OIC/ RSO numbers saved.
CLS personnel will be present at all times.

subtasks.hazard: Soldiers becoming lost during land navigation training

values: All Soldiers will have their cell phones on their person during training for emergency situations, they will also have chem lights and head lamps for extra visibility at night.
All Soldiers will have their cell phones on them in case of emergency.
All Soldiers will be briefed on panic azimuths and range boundaries.
All Soldiers will be given the cell phone numbers of NCOIC, OIC before leaving for the lane.
NCOIC, OIC, RANGE SAFETIES.
Each vehicle will adhere to posted speed limits and maintain a following distance of no less than 50 meters
All air guards and drivers will wear harnesses, helmets, and body armor
Ground guides will be in plain view of drivers and will be utilized when pulling vehicles off of hardball roads, particularly IVO linkup point.
All personnel will be briefed before the beginning of the operation.

draw.overall_supervision_plan: I assess the overall initial risk to be medium due to critical severity of seldom probability.I assess the overall residual risk to be low due to moderate severity of unlikely probability. Most Dangerous Risk: Vehicle AccidentMitigation: Foot movements will all be conducted off roads on the troop marching trail or inside the training areas. Soldiers will have visible markings during day and night movements. Road crossings will be deliberate and only occur at designated locations.Most Likely Risk: Lower extremity injury during movement on uneven terrain under limited visibilityMitigation: Lane walkers will be CLS qualified. A casevac vehicle will be present at all times.
